item.name: Crime and Federal Government Surveillance Subcommittee
Crime and Federal Government Surveillance Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: Federal Prison Bureau Nonviolent Offender Relief Act of 2005 - Amends the Federal criminal code to direct the Bureau of Prisons, pursuant to a good time policy, to release a prisoner who has served one half or more of his or her term of imprisonment if that prisoner: (1) has attained age 45; (2) has never been convicted of a crime of violence; and (3) has not engaged in any violation, involving violent conduct, of institutional disciplinary regulations.

bill.title: Federal Prison Bureau Nonviolent Offender Relief Act of 2005

item.title: Federal Prison Bureau Nonviolent Offender Relief Act of 2005
Federal Prison Bureau Nonviolent Offender Relief Act of 2005
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide an alternate release date for certain nonviolent offenders, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
